meanings.sent1: I need to refile the documents in the cabinet.
meanings.sent2: Remember to refile the papers after you finish reading them.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mixed up the papers, so I had to refile them all over again.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a messy desk, needing to refile thoughts constantly.
meanings.sent5: The librarian had to refile the books in perfect order to maintain the library's organization.

meanings.sent1: Please refile your application if you made any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The student had to refile his essay after making corrections.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the student to refile his homework for a better grade.
meanings.sent4: She had to refile her complaint to ensure it was properly addressed.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to refile his entry form due to missing information.

meanings.definition: To place back in a file or folder
meanings.sent1: After reviewing the document, remember to refile it in the correct folder.
meanings.sent2: I always refile important papers to keep them organized.
meanings.sent3: The secretary had to refile the papers after accidentally mixing them up.
meanings.sent4: She had to refile the contract in the folder labeled 'Contracts'.
meanings.sent5: It is essential to refile documents promptly to avoid misplacement.
